website_summaries.verdict: Flashlight doesn't require batteries to operate, using solar or a hand crank for power.
pros: Excellent emergency flashlight that's ideal in situations where relying on a battery is inconvenient
Stores power from attached solar panels or from a hand crank
Gives you 3 lighting modes to help meet different emergency situations
cons: Not as powerful as other flashlights
Solar charging doesn't last as long as some other models

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something in front of Hurricane Florence that would be sustainable for a week if needed. This wasn't my first "hurricane rodeo" and when everything is shut down, there ARE no "I'll just go grab some batteries" option. The flashlight is simple to operate, works with a few spins of the wrist. This is NOT going to compete with those "survival, spots jets at 20K feet" type flashlights, but it's sure sufficient for finding your way down a dark hallway or getting into a closet to root around for something in complete darkness (and we DID get to test out those features LOL). Bought two - may buy more in teh future!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Still working. . .
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few hand crank lights over the years and this is the only one that still works. The LED's aren't super bright but good enough to get you by when camping, I wouldn't trust it to signal traffic or anything. I have been keeping mine in my backpack which sometimes gets left in the car so it has been exposed to temperature extremes on both ends. It has been exposed to water but never fully submerged. I am debating getting these as stocking stuffers for family. I believe everyone should have and emergency backup flashlight as well as candles.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for a kinetic flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what you think it is, we all know how kinetic flashlights work. The nice thing about this one is that there is a small solar panel on it as well. We leave it in a window sill so it just collects light all the time. It loses a star for brightness. Even fully charged it just isn't very bright. I will say it is a nice sized beam compared to other kinetic flashlights but as all of them suffer from the issue of lumens. Great for emergency flashlight though that you know you will never have to change the batteries in to use.
customer_reviews.author: Shots

customer_reviews.title: Excellent light for Bugout or any led light!
customer_reviews.text: Very little time/power/cranking to get this thing to light up bright and last a good while. Would prefer this over any flash light with batteries if I was out in the woods, might take a little muscle but it would never run out of power, plus the solar panel makes it 10x better since most the time you wont even have to crank if it is in the sun during the day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: Great flashlight! Feels well built/solid and LED's are bright (3 modes; 1 LED, 3LED and flashing). You best have an arm of steel because the instructions say to turn the crank 3x/second to get a good charge. ... Solar panel is a welcome feature.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: brightness is very poor
customer_reviews.text: i am no paid top reviewer i understand if you dont want to be seen when waving this off ur roof top to get saved, as dim is this is.. i had a full hand crank one before hand and it 3 times as bright and i bought is as a 2 pack yrs ago at a store.. had to get a new one and well i ended up with this. atlest it is somewhat bright, u dont always want something to bright to be seen when SHTF or steath camping or lights go out from a storm.. i will do more test on this and see how good the over all brightness is
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great little light - brilliant design
customer_reviews.text: We got these for emergencies - work great. Granted it's no high-powered Mag-Lite, but the light is plenty bright. Super smart design! The hand crank works great, although I haven't tried the solar recharge yet, I'm very very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: NM Flash

customer_reviews.title: Always Ready!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flashlight! So much so that after buying one for my husband, I immediately bought one for myself. We had a couple of the strictly "hand crank" versions, but this is far superior because it has a solar strip and you can just park it in a window and it is alway there, waiting for you when the power goes out. It holds a charge MUCH longer than the oder crank models. I take being prepared for outages and emergencies very seriously and these are a great value and a great investment. Each family member should have their own, but warning - they need to write their names on "theirs".
customer_reviews.author: Fenicio

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best "wind up" flashlight that I've used
customer_reviews.text: brightness and efficiency. It takes very little effort to charge the unit, and while I haven't actually measured the distance, I will make a guess that it has sufficient power to illuminate objects effectively at two blocks or more. City blocks vary from one locality to another, so I'll call that about 800 feet. "illuminate effectively" is also highly subjective. In my case, I can easily see my dog while letting him outside at my cabin when he's across the street and also nearly at my neighbor's cabin.
customer_reviews.author: DMWood

customer_reviews.title: When a tornado takes out the substation, you might need this.
customer_reviews.text: I saw this flashlight reviewed on a prepper website. It claimed that a minute of cranking would get you an hour of light. It came with a reasonably charged internal Ni-MH battery so I cannot tell if the claim is true until I discharge the battery, but it does appear to be sturdy, bright enough for the usual tasks, and light in weight. The switch seems good, too. I do wish that I could charge it via usb or an adapter before an anticipated use. The hand crank feels solid. I am hopeful. I will post again after I have a bit more experience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Quiet Mind

customer_reviews.title: Good SOS, and bright enough.
customer_reviews.text: Went through sandy with one crank up light. I was glad I had it. Now I wont get caught with out enough, or not have one in my bag. Or not have emergency food and water... It was very tough to get batteries, food and water. Stores closed. Not because they had no food . Because they could not get to there stores... Even when the city had the fire hydrant on. You had to lug it up lots of floors in a blacked out stair case. It was very dangers.... But we still know that we were lucky. At lest we still had are home.
customer_reviews.author: M.J

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Young Child Friendly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a flashlight for 5 kids to share for play. We’ve been very impressed with how it’d held up, battery life, and how little it takes to recharge! It’s been a fun, practical way to teach about energy as well.
customer_reviews.author: BooksMusicTea

customer_reviews.title: Present for Grandson
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 yr old grandson. He liked playing with one of my flashlights but he drained the batteries. I bought this so he wouldn't have to worry about batteries. He loves it. It's holding up to a 5 yr old abuse so far. May buy one for myself for when the power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H

customer_reviews.title: SUNLIGHT DOES NOT CHARGE IT..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this flashlight last year and stashed it in my backpack for an emergency. It doesn't charge from the sun. I have placed it under direct sunlight for hours at a time. It only works when I crank it. Are these supposed to become unusable after several months of no use. I don't think I'll buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: JSL

customer_reviews.title: ThorFire Solar Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 ThorFire flashlights for our home, RV & car simply because they are light weight, affective & reliable at all times, especially in an emergency! No batteries to worry about EVER! We typically charge them every couple of weeks by simply leaving them out in the sun or daylight for the solar cells on each unit to keep the batteries charged. Having the crank is always a plus if needed. We don’t use or need battery powered flashlights anymore!
customer_reviews.author: J Soltani

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and bright
customer_reviews.text: I took it camping - and between leaving it out in the sun and occasionally cranking it, it turned on every time I needed it, and stayed on. I use it as a flashlight around the house also - I set it out on the porch to get sun and give it an occasional crank. This is the second one I've bought because it is so useful.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene R. Carra

customer_reviews.title: Holds charge for long time
customer_reviews.text: Solar charge worked well and allowed light to maintain brightness for a long time. Cranking handle recharged batteries enough to maintain brightness when needed. Well made as I dropped light several times and there was no noticeable damage and light maintained brightness. Leaving light out to charge in the day was sufficient to charge batteries enough for the night.
customer_reviews.author: WileyTweety

customer_reviews.title: nice flashlight
customer_reviews.text: The flashlight projects a decent amount of light, enough to illuminate a nice size area. It is a bit dim, but in an emergency it is more than adequate. I have not dropped it, but the casing feels durable enough to survive a few drops. The crank feels solid, no wiggling of the handle. I have not had a chance to run the battery down, so I cannot comment on how long it will last before needing to be recharged. I was impressed with it enough to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: n.robertson

customer_reviews.title: Bogus spec for light duration for 1 minute of cranking
customer_reviews.text: Because I found the specification that 1 minute of cranking would generate an hour of light had to believe I ran a test. I discharge the light to a point where the light were on but dim. I cranked for 60 seconds and ran the lamp on 3 light bulbs. It was usable for about 7 minutes. Usable to where the illumination was about 1/4 of one bulb at 100% power. Other than the bogus specification I am okay with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I got mine ! How about you ?
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is neat. It may not be the brightest flashlight in the drawer but it definitely does the job. This thing will pay for it self in about a month seeing how we always are grabbing for a flashlight. It’s lightweight but feels solid. And never having to replace the batteries...COME ON! Yes-I paid for mine.
customer_reviews.author: P36jet

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product in a new box. Not cool.
customer_reviews.text: I received a used and damaged flashlight in a new box? The front and corners of the box are visibly damaged and full of wood like dust particles. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Victeka

customer_reviews.title: Old tech, flawed and overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Odd design. Very small battery. Low light level. No charging with cable. No solar charging light indicator to.know if it's being charged or to know when it's finished charging. Very very overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: We Review Products

customer_reviews.title: Slick unit!
customer_reviews.text: This a great little light! Its bright, focused light is always ready with the solar as well as hand-crank charging. Being waterproof to 45 ft. is another bonus! It feels a little clunky in the hand, and the crank handle doesn't always stay firmly stowed, but these are minor issues when weighed against its functionality.
customer_reviews.author: DPelham

customer_reviews.title: So nice I had to buy two.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well constructed and the solar panel provides an alternative to cranking. It's a little slick, and if the black bands had been textured/rubberized it would make for a better hold. Cranking it is stiff, and a minute is about all I can go, but you do get a considerable amount of time for the effort.
customer_reviews.author: RayJay

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: We have always taken our small dog out in a 1 acre front yard at night with a flashlight due to critters, Eagles, etc. This works very well. Lowest setting is good and high is perfect. It's not a Creed LED, but it sure is nice. I'll buy another one for the car. Don't know about battery life yet but it seems fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This appears well made and works as advertised, but it's not ergonomically pleasing to the hand. The entire grip is uncomfortable, especially when you are operating the crank. It should have a friendly, rubberized edge or at least a rounded edge. This one digs into your hand. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: John Brzezinski

customer_reviews.title: Its a must have when emergency
customer_reviews.text: So... so far so good I only bought this cause last October a tornado came to my area and I was without power for like a week and a half. Very very dark wasn't prepare we were shock that it came. But now I bought this I been testing it out and we'll it's good. I'll give it till like maybe 2 years and I'll re-update if this buy was worth it. :)
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Beam Me Up, Scotty!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product & you can't beat it for the price. It's shaped like a Star Trek phaser & It has three light settings from low to high & flashing strobe. It's very durable & feels as if it will last. I wound it up 5 days ago & it's still bright today.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS E FAGAN

customer_reviews.title: Great light and long-lasting!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a flashlight that I would not have to hunt down batteries for. I used the crank for a minute per the instructions and the flashlight lasted for a long time--I did not initially have on constantly so it lasted about a week with turning on and off. I used mostly to walk my dog at night. I did have it on all night when I went on a trip with my sun--he wanted a night light, and I had the flashlight. It stayed bright all night for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency flash light.
customer_reviews.text: Great emergency flashlight. Best part is the crank generator. I want to have this product when the lights go out and stay out for a long time. When all the batteries are spent and the sun is behind thick cloud cover, I will have light.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flashlight because I was sick and tired of buying batteries and I hate the environmental impact of discarded batteries because we live in a rural area where there is no battery recycling. If the beam it produced was a bit brighter I would have rated this flashlight 5 stars but it's certainly bright enough to use in the house and yard during power failures and whenever needed. We live in Mexico where it's sunny nearly every day so the flashlight quickly recharges from the solar charger on the flashlight. It also works well using the hand crank to charge it up. I highly recommend this flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This solar/crank light is well worth the price. Don't forget to peel off clear plastic on solar panel.
customer_reviews.author: T P

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Great non-battery crank flashlight, used it twice during power outages and was a great help.
customer_reviews.author: Blacky

customer_reviews.title: Good to have where electricity supply is epileptic
customer_reviews.text: Good to have where electricity supply is epileptic. However, the brightness is not fantastic. After winding it up, the brightness is manageable. But, it gets dimmer in about a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Added a Second
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for years now. It's real nice to have a quick flashlight that I never need to worry about batteries. My 2 year old grabs these and tries to destroy them, but they've held up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Verrone86

customer_reviews.title: Purse component and emergency flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Fairly luminescent. Won't light up a camp site like a high-lumen lamp, will allow one to navigate through the dark and dimly see at least 10-15 feet ahead. Charges well via solar panels and with the hand crank. I own an LED headlamp that's much brighter, though when those batteries have no more power, this will be my go-to. ... Also, my cat's name is Thor. THIS IS HIS MANIFESTATION IN ILLUMINATING-TOOL FORM. <3 ^D^
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: I love these flashlights. It seems as though they never die with little effort in charging. I wish it had a little bit of a wider area for light, but other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: bigk1902

customer_reviews.title: it worked
customer_reviews.text: so i bought this as a backup should things go wrong it will serve that purpose, it arrived quickly and performed as advertised, it is a little dim but it will work during times of extended power outages if needed, this was just part of a larger hurricane preparedness kit, it is a good choice I think
customer_reviews.author: mike lazar

customer_reviews.title: Works well when u need a flashlight, dont need batteries
customer_reviews.text: Nice crank lights i prefer these to any other flashlight, keep one in the car by the bed and in the garage, never worry about batteries again, and if your car dies or powers out use it to charge your phone and obviously use it as a flashlight so u dont have to use your phone as one bc u dont have power
customer_reviews.author: Recreational Music

customer_reviews.title: Revised Review
customer_reviews.text: After using for a couple of weeks, I realized that it is inconvenient because it doesn’t have a strap handle and it also doesn’t give off enough light. The crank to brighten the light fell off several times. Sorry I purchased this flashlight. My other solar flashlight that I had for years from LL Bean was much better.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Flashlight Rechargeable
customer_reviews.text: Another item for ToGo Emergency pack. Recommend to charge up this item every 3 months. Doesn't take long to recharge it. Make sure it works. Great value for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Leala Jew

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Not sure how long the battery life lasts because I haven't tested it but I do know it charges with hand crank! Goes in my prepper stash
customer_reviews.author: rrranch

customer_reviews.title: Put one of these in your vehicle!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Couple of minutes cranking gives 30-40 minutes of bright enough light. All day in sun gives hours of light. Water proof for real. Left in rain all day no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Worked for an entire 30 seconds. Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: By the 5 crank on the flashlight, the handle's knob fell off. No way to reattach it. This piece of ---- is going back today.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: She is able to use the crank very easily. Great brightness
customer_reviews.text: We got this flashlight for my daughter who is afraid of the dark. We had been using battery operated flashlights but she would burn up the batteries by leaving it on all night. We decided to order a crank flashlight so she would have to learn to crank it if she wanted the light. She is able to use the crank very easily. Great brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: No Batteries No Excuse
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an add-on graduation gift for a camper. I like that it cranks or is solar powered but I would like it better if it were brighter.
customer_reviews.author: Pixelchic

customer_reviews.title: Yup... works just fine...
customer_reviews.text: Light is a little dimmer, even with the three bulbs on, than I was looking for, but it works well for finding small things in the dark, and should be visible for quite a distance. Solar function works very well, and the hand crank works very well. Take care of it and it will take care of you...
customer_reviews.author: Samtzu

customer_reviews.title: Power House Light!
customer_reviews.text: We have had a few power outages this winter, I had plenty of battery operated flashlights but I really like the crank Solar power as a backup
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works well. Even if the solar panel isn't in direct sunlight, it still gives some light, and a few seconds of cranking works wonders. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Perkin Warbeck

customer_reviews.title: Great to have
customer_reviews.text: I've had this light for a looong time before reviewing - crank is strong, works well, very sturdy, fits great in hand, affordable, solar charge is ..... well, it's solar so, it takes a very looong time to charge that way - all in all a great buy for a nice light that will always be ready to go - I am NOT a paid off reviewer
customer_reviews.author: ruski3:16

customer_reviews.title: Emergency flashlight
customer_reviews.text: The hand crank is the best I have ever had. I have not tested the solar part yet. The hand crank, LED's and the battery capacity is great. I bought two of them. I'm completely satisfied. If asked I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t try living without light!
customer_reviews.text: The world keeps teaching us to expect the unexpected. These lights are an important part of being ahead of the power curve.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry E. Teaff

customer_reviews.title: good so far
customer_reviews.text: Works fine so far. Not real bright be only need about 50 lumins for camping. Battery hold a charge better than most. Will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Quality, Brightness & Price
customer_reviews.text: Love this light. Camping in Northern Arizona and needed a light that was easy to charge, led lights and versital lighting options. Perfect in every way. Charges quickly and with back up crank. Bright enough to scan our 30+' camp area for critters. The 2 level setting for brightness, along with the flashing mode is great! Price was great! Go for it!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R

customer_reviews.title: VERY BRIGHT and extremely well made!!
customer_reviews.text: Very bright and high quality. Don't think there is any better on the market! Only need a few cranks for 10 minutes of light! A+++++
customer_reviews.author: Missileman

customer_reviews.title: Never be stranded in the dark!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent flashlite to keep in my vehicle. It's will always be useful with no possibility of corrosion. I can either crank it or use the solar charging function. I plan to order more for Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Battery is really bad
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of minutes of really good cranking I get 3 or less minutes of good battery before the light dims so much that is not useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Good emergency supply.
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof at 5 meters, easy to use, good amount of light.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright flashlight,
customer_reviews.text: Nice bright emergency light, easy crank...great for our emergency kits
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Holt

customer_reviews.title: This is a million times better than an emergency flashlight with corroded or drained batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is a million times better than an emergency flashlight with corroded or drained batteries. I keep mine in the drawer with the scissors, scotch tape, etc. so I can remember to crank it every few weeks. It's lightweight and cranks easily and the light is bright enough to find one's way home at night on a backwoods dirt road. Someone here complained about its being noisy when you crank it. It does make a buzzing noise when you crank it, but the 60 secs of disturbance that the cranking makes in the nighttime woods is nothing compared to the disturbance in the environment from , discarded corroded batteries, cheapo plastic flashlight casings, etc. etc.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: We like them.
customer_reviews.text: We own 4. Never have to worry about batteries. These are great for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Chef E

customer_reviews.title: Very good product and mine holds a charge for 6months before ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product and mine holds a charge for 6months before I put it into the sun for a few hours for a good free solar charging.
customer_reviews.author: Aquanuttcase

customer_reviews.title: Not bright enough, needs 5 LED’s
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but needs 5 LED’s instead of only 3!
customer_reviews.author: Duane R. Miller Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Seems solidly made. I wish it could bypass the on-off flashing feature, but that's minor
customer_reviews.author: Hagsrus

customer_reviews.title: Shines bright
customer_reviews.text: Works for quite awhile after winding it up for about one minute.
customer_reviews.author: eagerbeaver

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Easy to crank and lasts a long time. Could be brighter but for the price it definitely met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bright
customer_reviews.text: It’s a descend solar flashlight for car but it’s not bright. I would use a different flashlight for camping
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cranking lamp with solar charge
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cranking flashlight with useful solar panel. It provides good light.
customer_reviews.author: Renata Horvath-Riba

customer_reviews.title: I See The Light
customer_reviews.text: We have had this flashlight for awhile now. Super handy and always reliable. The light isn’t the brightest but you can count on it working at least. We have a toddler that finds flashlights and kills their batteries lol
customer_reviews.author: Jean L.

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I used it for camping, and bought two more to have them in my cars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: it serves it purpose does not give off enough light i wish it was brighter .
customer_reviews.author: serenity

customer_reviews.title: Very nice energy efficient and Bright Flashlights.
customer_reviews.text: It charges well from both the Crank and Solar Panel, it has a low energy setting, a bright setting that's still energy saving because it uses LED's and it's very quickly rechargeable and it is waterproof at least up to 5 Meters deep. I think these flashlights are fantastic and they are Eco-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Castle

customer_reviews.title: For Emergency
customer_reviews.text: This is a great flashlight to have for emergency. No true battery needed. Durable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Reba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent excellent device that everyone should have
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? I love this thing and everyone that I buy 1/4 as a gift loves me for it. Yeah there are several other hand crank flashlights, but for Simplicity plus the added picture of solar power, and inexpensive, this one was a fantastic purchase and I would buy it several times over
customer_reviews.author: ernesto gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great little light
customer_reviews.text: Lots of features for the price. Bright for its size.
customer_reviews.author: William Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Solar and hand powered flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, now I have an emergency light that doesn't need batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little light
customer_reviews.text: Ok for what it is supposed to do. I dont like that the on off is low/high/flashing. Should just be on/off. I put it in my lights out bag in the event of a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Grogg

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should get the thorfire solar flashlight. It'sa great investment.
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this type of flashlight in the movie crawl. I liked what I saw & had to have one. When I received my flashlight, l was amazed how light it was in weight & the brightness was amazing. I bought a second flashlight. I keep one in the house & the 2nd flashlight in my car glove compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Sal fiore

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use without replacing batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Good hand cranck/solar flashlight for the price. Have experienced no problems during use.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Bright and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these to prepare for a hurricane. They are very bright and are easy to use. My kids even know how to wind them up and use them Incase we loose power!
customer_reviews.author: Klegaspi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good beam
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, a little bulkier than I’d like but that’s not a big issue. Solar charger works great, I’ve used it a few days and never lost power on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: never needs batteries
customer_reviews.text: i keep mine in my truck, don't have to worry about dead batteries
customer_reviews.author: jersey-west

customer_reviews.title: Great Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flash light for a camping trip this summer. I honestly think it's a great flashlight to just have in the house for if the power goes out. I also don't have to worry about spending money on batteries I have to keep replacing. It's really simple to use its brighter than I expected it to be and it's really compact not big and bulky so it's easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Melton

customer_reviews.title: Lights up in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: A great backup light. Always ready in any emergency!! Easy to use and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blackout
customer_reviews.text: Perefect. Had a Blackout and this came im very handy
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Barretojr

customer_reviews.title: Stop and don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Never got it to work. Gave to a friend that had one just like it. they wanted the crank handle to fix the one he had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: still works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old son. He's tough on stuff but hasn't managed to break it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Love this flashlight. I just gotta crank it up a few times and it lights up really well. Took it out in the poring rain and it worked. Dropped it by mistake and no damage. Great product, definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pearlz D.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work at all and returned. Then was shorted $3 on my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for old timers and for emergency kits
customer_reviews.text: Well made and simple to operate, about as bright as regular flashlights lite and holds a charge with little effort. Great gift for old timers and for emergency kits. Pros Easy to use, durable with long runtime. Cons Bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: And a week-long camping trip work very nice doesn't actually need total sunlight to charge
customer_reviews.text: And a week-long camping trip work very nice doesn't actually need total sunlight to charge. One thing I'd like to have is a place to charge something or to charge it up usb port
customer_reviews.author: Jason Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Cool little light!
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly small and I wonder how long the handle will hold up, but the cool factor is definitely there. Received it 1/25/2017. Will update this review when the battery goes kaput. Hopefully not soon.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Williams

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit but quick customer service
customer_reviews.text: My unit was defective. But the seller quickly replied and refunded my money.
customer_reviews.author: michael cartusciello

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Lasts a long time. Not too heavy. If it had a cell phone charger adapter it would get five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica L

customer_reviews.title: Great light for my prepper kit!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, good light. Solar & crank charging makes it great for my prepper kit. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get one!
customer_reviews.text: Product is well made and works as advertised. I bought 5 as stocking stuffers!
customer_reviews.author: hectus423

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a well made product, not cheap made. Light seems strong. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Doo Dah

customer_reviews.title: Certainly not in the category of a spotlight but would be sufficient for emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: Gave as gift. Seems to work OK. Should be good backup up for flashlights with chargers or batteries. No waiting while your light charges up!
customer_reviews.author: C B Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: My husband had one and lost it. He loves the wind up. Works good
customer_reviews.author: Deneen

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This unit was everything I expected. I do like very much, however, it's not as bright as I think it should be. But for an emergency light it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: jeffery decker

product_meta.title: ThorFire Solar Flashlight Hand Crank Solar Powered Rechargeable Flashlight IPX6 Waterproof LED Emergency Flashlights Lights Dynamo Torch Ideal for Camping Outdoor Climbing Backpack Hiking
feature_bullets: ▶ Solar & Hand crank powered flashlights no batteries needed. This no battery flashlight is perfect for emergencies, power outages or anytime you need light.
▶ High Efficiency of Energy Conversion Cranking Flashlight: Just 1 minute cranking will generate enough power for 1 hour long using time.

▶ IPX6 Waterproof and Submersible up to 45 feet. Very durable and handy tool for home and outdoor use. Such as for Vehicle use, Camping, Hiking, Travel Etc. Whether you do survival adventure or rock climbing this no battery spotlight is a must have.
▶ Bright Flashlight:This solar powered torch light is equipped with high quality LED bulb. Very portable and bright flashlights. Put it in the sun or wind it up to recharge.
▶ After-sales Service: ThorFire will provide customers with ONE YEAR hassle-free after-sales service. Order with no worries!
